content: In the tightly controlled city of Stenograd, life runs on the invisible rails of the Behavioral Compliance Index—until Marek Halden, its architect, is found dead and the system begins to falter. As the Council fractures, thousands of residents stage a daring “data strike,” scrambling their records and plunging public services into chaos. People step up to help one another in the confusion, and solidarity blooms on the streets. When the Directorate pushes for brutal crackdowns, Councilor Nikola Petrak quietly stalls their efforts, giving space for neighborhood assemblies to rise. These local groups take charge, openly voting on resources and organizing support while Council authority collapses. Attempts by Directorate loyalists to sabotage the new order are publicly exposed and repelled, turning citizens’ loyalty toward their own leaders. Though assemblies face fierce debates and shortages, a sense of agency and hope takes root, and Stenograd—once governed by algorithms—learns to pulse with human resilience again.
